summary: An email from a victim to a legal recipient, containing a victim impact statement submitted to the court arguing against Ghislaine Maxwell's pre-trial release. The victim describes Maxwell's abuse, manipulative behavior, and lack of remorse, and implores the court to keep her incarcerated to ensure she stands trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the victim's statement; described as a psychopath who sexually abused the victim as a child, groomed victims for Jeffrey Epstein, and is argued to be a flight risk who should remain incarcerated before trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the person for whom Maxwell procured victims; his relationship with Maxwell is cited as part of her parasitic lifestyle.

connections.description: Maxwell played a central role in procuring victims for Epstein, and relied on him and others to fund her lavish lifestyle.
Maxwell sexually abused the victim as a child, was charming and manipulative during the grooming process, and has repeatedly lied about the victim and their family.

events.title: Victim submits statement opposing Maxwell's bail
events.description: A victim submits a statement to the court requesting Ghislaine Maxwell not be released on bail prior to her trial, detailing the abuse suffered and arguing Maxwell is a flight risk and danger to the community.

keyFacts: A victim states Ghislaine Maxwell sexually abused her as a child and played a central role in procuring victims for Jeffrey Epstein.
The victim describes Maxwell as a psychopath who is charming, manipulative, lacks empathy and remorse, and has a history of lying.
The victim argues Maxwell is a flight risk who would flee the country if released on bail to avoid trial and possible continued imprisonment.
The victim states Maxwell has lived a parasitic lifestyle funded by Epstein and others, and her primary concern is her own welfare, even if it harms others.
The document is a victim impact statement submitted to the court in December 2020 as part of pre-trial proceedings regarding Maxwell's bail.
